title: CAPA Pet of the Week: Aja
text:
Aja is a 10 year-old female, black and white American bulldog available for adoption at the Lompoc Animal Center, 1501 West Central Ave. She weighs approximately 83 pounds.

Aja is a 10 year-old female, black and white American bulldog available for adoption at the Lompoc Animal Center, 1501 West Central Ave. She weighs approximately 83 pounds.
Aja is a mature pup who loves to play, cuddle — and nap. Her snoring will make you giggle, center staff say.
Her adoption fees include spay, microchip, vaccinations, flea treatment, and health/wellness exam.
Members of the public can stop by between 10 a.m. and 6 p.m. Tuesday through Monday to meet Aja, or make an appointment to meet her or any of the available animals by calling the shelter at 833-422-8413 or visiting
countyofsb.org/phd/animal/petsearch.sbc
Want to help but aren’t ready to commit? All adoptable animals, and those too young to yet be adopted, are available for fostering. Visit
www.countyofsb.org/1416/Foster to apply.
To learn about shelter partners Animal Services and CAPA, visit
www.LompocCAPA.org where a shelter wish list and information on how to become a volunteer and donation opportunities can be found.
